chat_message_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

created_add

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

get_next_by_created_add(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateField: created_add>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_created_add(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateField: created_add>, is_next=False, **kwargs)
id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

chat.tests module

chat.views module

chat.views.chat(request)

This view returns the individual chat rooms as well as the new posts if they exist.

chat.views.get_currently_logged_users()[source]

This function in view returns the current user

chat.views.imprint(request)[source]

This view renders the imprint part

chat.views.landing_page(request)[source]

This view of the landing page returns the logged in users in the menu

chat.views.login_view(request)[source]

This view controls the user’s login and directs him to room 1 if necessary

chat.views.logout_view(request)[source]

This function controls the logout process

chat.views.register(request)[source]

In this view, the registration of the users is processed and, if the registration is successful, they are forwarded to the respective chat room

chat.views.update_messages(request)[source]

This view function updates the new messages in the respective chat rooms

chat.views.view_determine(request)[source]

This function returns the current chat room
